bioghist.p: Stephen T. Harty was an artist-naturalist in the Exhibits Department of the Academy of Natural Sciences of Philadelphia from 1956 to 1982. He was responsible for many of the dioramas at the Academy. He was director of the Expeditions for Everyone program from 1972 to 1977, and established the "Rare Bird Branch," a group of people who supported the program. Harty retired from the Academy in 1982. He was interested in ornithology, and was a member and past president of the Delaware Valley Ornithological Club.

scopecontent.p: The collection consists of scrapbooks, birding notes, and materials related to Harty's career with the Academy of Natural Sciences. Included are photographs and diagrams of Harty's work on the Academy's dioramas; birding journals, including location information, date, and a description of the circumstances of the observation; correspondence related to work Harty did on Barro Colorado Island; schedules and newsletters from the Expeditions for Everyone program (1973-1978); newsletters and member lists for the "Rare Bird Branch"; photographs taken by Harold T. Green in Africa and photos of Green from his military service; photos possibly taken by Charles Mohr of caves and cave fauna; a Delaware Valley Ornithological Club album (1965-1999); original watercolors of birds by Richard Ellis; and an album of plates from Rodolphe Meyer de Schauensee's The Birds of Venezuela.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
